body.p:
Bowling Green Ky. Apl 18th/63
To the Hon J, F Robinson Governor of Ky

Your petitioners beg to present the case of Charles Buckhanan, who was fined by the Warren Equity & Criminal Court ^at its August term 1862 for Fourteen Dollars^ for permitting slaves to assemble at his house -- The circumstances as we understand them are that several negroes met at sd house without the knowledge consent of invitation of sd Buckhanan & that often they had been there a short time sd Buckhanan ordered them to go to their respective homes. It was during Christmas week & the slaves were generally permitted by their masters to spend the week pretty much as they pleased -- Buckhhanan is a poor man with a family to support, & works well so far as we have ever heard & is not able to pay sd fine without taking the necessaries of life from his family -- Therefore we ^(his neighbors)^ most respectfully petition that he be released from sd fine -- With much respect we are your humble petitions

J S Willoughby
G G Lodge
Z Sears
J,, P,, Isbell
A. F. Kennedy
G T Sears
W. T. Lodge
Thomas Payne
J. M. Cacby
A Sears
T G Lodge
J A Heill
J S Willoughby

I know nothing of the facts in the case set forth above, but I know several of the Gentn. whose names are attached to the above petition & they are clever, reliable men, they state what they believe to be true -- Mr. Buckhanan respectfully asks a respose to his petition --

Yr. Obt. Svt.
Wm V. Loving
To Gov. Robinson

Warren Eq. & Crim Ct
The fine in this case is remitted
J F Robinson
$14 } Mis
send to W V Loving
Bowlingreen
Chas Buchanon
Isd Apr 21. 1863.
